title: Corot: An Exhibition of His Paintings and Graphics
description: This exhibit was a comprehensive retrospective of Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot, the French painter and printmaker whose career flourished in the nineteenth century. His work was largely devoted to landscapes, although he often painted portraits of people too. Throughout the exhibit, which held over one-hundred works, one can see how Corot’s stylistic choices predicted later identifying features of the Impressionist movement.

input: Corot: An Exhibition of His Paintings and Graphics
